meanings.def: a flower with a sweet smell that grows on a bush with thorns (= sharp points) on its stems
examples: He gave me a single red rose.
Prices rose 2 per cent in December.
Five rows of chairs were set out facing the whiteboard.
She rows across the river, helping passengers reach the other side.

meanings.def: a piece of metal or plastic with small holes in it that is attached to the end of a pipe or watering can so that the water comes out in a fine spray when you are watering plants
a round object that is fixed to the ceiling of a room for the wires of an electric light to go through
to be developing in a successful way
(not) an easy or a pleasant situation
examples: Their life together hasn't exactly been a bed of roses.

meanings.def: to still have a good reputation, even though you have been involved in something that might have given people a bad opinion of you
examples: Nobody ever knew the details and he came out of the deal smelling of roses.

meanings.def: what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called

idioms.def: to be developing in a successful way
(not) an easy or a pleasant situation
examples: Their life together hasn't exactly been a bed of roses.

idioms.idiom: come up/out of something smelling of roses
idioms.def: to still have a good reputation, even though you have been involved in something that might have given people a bad opinion of you
examples: Nobody ever knew the details and he came out of the deal smelling of roses.

idioms.idiom: a rose by any other name would smell as sweet
idioms.def: what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
